page.title: 04MALVERN THEATRE
page.content: The Malvern Festival Theatre was opened on July 1st, 1885 as the Great Hall of the Malvern Assembly Rooms.It started off as the Malvern Assembly Rooms and Pleasure Gardens in which a company was incorparated in 1883.The main hall is now the theatre.The council bought the theatre.They lifted the floor with extra bricks to let the people see everything,and they built a false ceiling.They added a projection room which was to control the sound and the lighting.They built the circle,which has 350 seats.The stalls have 450 seats.There used to be 960 seats,but the council widened all the rows so that the audience would be more comfortable.There is an orchestral pit to take 26 musicians. Backstage there are 8 dressing-rooms.
